text.section:
The Board may issue a temporary license to a podiatrist licensed in another state to practice or teach podiatry in this State if:
The license issued from the other state has licensing requirements equivalent to those in this State; and
The licensed podiatrist pays a temporary license fee as determined by the Board.

A temporary license temporarily authorizes the licensee to practice podiatry, while the license is effective, only on:
Patients of the health care facility or program named on the license; or
Patients of a health care facility or program that is:
Affiliated for training purposes with the health care facility or program named on the temporary license; and
Approved by the Board.
A temporary license may be issued for a term of 3 months and may be renewed at the discretion of the Board.
